description:
'''Daniel Gerard Breland''' (born July 18, 1995), known [[mononym]]ously as '''Breland''' ({{IPAc-en|'|b|r|iː|l|ə|n|d}} {{respell|BREE|lənd}}; stylized in [[all caps]]), is an American rapper, singer, songwriter and record producer of a hybrid of [[country music|country]], [[rap]], [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]], [[gospel music|gospel]], and [[soul music]]. His 2019 debut single, "[[My Truck]]", rose to prominence the following year after gaining popular attention via social media, reaching No. 26 on ''Billboard''{{'}}s [[Hot Country Songs]] chart, and was remixed with [[Sam Hunt]] before being certified [[RIAA certification|platinum]] for sales of one million units as of January 2021.

Breland has so far released two [[Extended play|EPs]] on Bad Realm/[[Atlantic Records]], and his music been streamed on Spotify over 150 million times. He released his first full-length album, ''[[Cross Country (Breland album)|Cross Country]]'', in September 2022.
